results.title: Simvastatin improves endothelial function in patents with subclinical hypothyroidism.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ improves endothelial @<m>DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@function@@@ in patents with @DISEASE_Asymptomatic_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D058345 @@@subclinical hypothyroidism@@@.

citations.NLM: Duman D, Sahin S, Esertas K, Demirtunc R. Simvastatin improves endothelial function in patents with subclinical hypothyroidism. Heart Vessels. 2007 Mar;22(2):88-93. PMID: 17390202

results.title: Simvastatin improves left ventricular function after myocardial infarction in hypercholesterolemic rabbits by anti-inflammatory effects.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ treatment not only prevented deterioration of LV @<m>DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@function@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@ but improved LV @<m>DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@function@@@ (dP/dtmax +130%; dP/dtmin +144%, P < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Bauersachs J, Hiss K, Fraccarollo D, Laufs U, Ruetten H. Simvastatin improves left ventricular function after myocardial infarction in hypercholesterolemic rabbits by anti-inflammatory effects. Cardiovasc Res. 2006 Dec 1;72(3):438-46. PMID: 17026973
citations.BibTeX: @article{17026973, title={Simvastatin improves left ventricular function after myocardial infarction in hypercholesterolemic rabbits by anti-inflammatory effects.}, author={Bauersachs J and Hiss K and Fraccarollo D and Laufs U and Ruetten H}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={72}, number={3}, pages={438-46}}

results.title: Ciprofloxacin and statin interaction: a cautionary tale of rhabdomyolysis.
results.text_hl: Initial management included intravenous crystalloid fluids and discontinuation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. CK level fell, liver @<m>DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@function@@@ slowly improved and renal @<m>DISEASE_Conversion_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003291 @@@function@@@ remained stable.

citations.NLM: Goldie FC, Brogan A, Boyle JG. Ciprofloxacin and statin interaction: a cautionary tale of rhabdomyolysis. BMJ Case Rep. 2016 Jul 28;2016():. PMID: 27469384
